intro: Cupania tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly cupania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
